text: hi everyone company chu tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
declan mckenna
album zeros this is the second major
label project to come from uk singer
songwriter declan mckenna who had a
breakthrough moment in the middle of the
2010s with
youthful tear jerkers such as brazil
songs that had a commercial appeal but
also a raw indie rock edge which is a
sound
and aesthetic he would embrace into the
deeper cuts of his 2017
lp what do you think about the car but
there was another side to declan
sound showcased in songs such as mind i
am everyone else
moments that had a bit of a retro flare
showcased a love of glam rock
and vintage pop rock which is something
he is really going
all in on with zeroes and
the more i listen to it the more i guess
i can't help but imagine declan
reaching out to me through a time warp
saying please
come with me we'll go back to the 1970s
and listen to bowie and the beatles
anything to escape the pandemic honestly
but i guess this current crop of songs
doesn't so much feel like a pure
exercise in nostalgia as much
as it is an attempt at making these
older ideas appeal to a contemporary
audience
and i do admit that declan and his
producer jay joyce do a decent job of
giving
these old glam rock vibes a modern punch
and heaviness but
outside of that there's not much to say
about their efforts here
the vocals for one are average just
painfully average for track after track
after track while declan's singing here
does come off more mature
than it did with the uh somewhat i guess
cracked yelping and screaming that he
engaged in every once in a while on his
last lp
that at least was more distinct than
what he's doing currently even if the
singing on his past record you couldn't
always categorize as being
good in the traditional sense and the
vocals aren't just
so so they're also pretty derivative the
singing on the opening track of this
thing is a dead ringer for something you
might hear on a cage the elephant record
and arguably gutsy or banned
so i do struggle with the vocals and
that i'm having a hard time finding
anything stupendous about the
performance
or even memorable about the timbre
delivery anything i would really have a
hard time picking them
out of a lineup then the story isn't
much different for the instrumentation
there's a lot of very grand and layered
glam rock and piano rock throughout this
album
which does come from a very specific
place in rock history
but it's very non-specific in its
presentation on this record
what declan and jay are doing on this lp
is so close
in style and tone to what it's borrowing
from i feel less like i'm listening to
an original work and more like i'm
watching an
elaborate series of dots just being
connected very passively
i guess i should also say this album
isn't simply derivative in one single
way
the track daniel you're still a child is
a heavy combination
of 80s rock and new wave with a
subtle talking heads twist there are
also a few songs in the track list that
sound like at their core
the strokes could have written them i
will say though occasionally
the songwriting does outshine the lack
of daring instrumentation and aesthetics
beautiful faces is a genuinely good song
no matter what kind of instrumentation
you wrap it in beautiful faces
eerie chorus melody haunting lyricism
and declan's vocal sound more animated
here than they are on
most of the album the pounding dance
rhythms cute glock melodies and buzzing
guitars
are all an added bonus rapture as well
as key to life on earth both have their
infectious moments too
especially the grand finishes both of
them present but it's not like the
writing is amazing from beginning to end
on this thing either
for example the track emily is a tedious
clash of
folky acoustic guitars psycpop vocal
harmonies
and a combo of funky drums and bass
there's even a woodwinds breakdown that
doesn't quite make sense
look for the most part zeros to me just
sounds like pastiche
after pastiche after pastiche is it
quite as bad or egregious as a group
like i don't know let's say greta van
fleet
no but it's getting kind of kind of
close a little close
it's uh flirting with the idea even if
some of the instrumental palettes are
slightly anachronistic or unlikely even
if there are a few intros here and there
that are a
bit unorthodox in a way i can't help but
feel like declan was closer
to something more interesting on his
last lp i don't know
i'm pretty indifferent toward this
project overall
but i guess i can't take away the fact
that declan at this point in his career
sounds like he has more going for him
than some other people who are his age
in the industry ultimately i think it's
just a case of doing something more
daring
and distinct with his sound the next
time around
i'm feeling a decent two strong five on
this one
tran position have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry
hit the bell as well over here next to
my head is another video that you can
check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel anthony fantano
declan mckenna forever
